Disc reading on emulators
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2012 Topics: Disc reading on emulators
By OgreBattle on Wednesday, June 27, 2012 - 10:37 am:

Has anyone played any of the monster ranchers on emulators? It's kind of funny...MR2 on an emulator can read some DVDs (most generate Zuum/Baku), but when it does it's usually basic types with a Zuum subtype. Gotten many like that--Henger/Zuum, Hare/Zuum, Monol/Zuum...not really complaining, because I can just combine those for other monsters I want, but how does that work? Thanks.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, June 28, 2012 - 10:37 am:

IIRC it was different on different emulators. Some did not have a workable shrine at all.

By OgreBattle on Thursday, June 28, 2012 - 01:47 pm:

Well, I'm using ePSXe 1.6 (1.7, the newest version, has a broken disc swapping feature).
I'm using PCSX2 for Monster Rancher 4 as well...disc swapping is also notoriously bad on that emulator, because the first swap will work but the second swap won't. For some reason, I've only got it to work once--by using the iso for MR2 and getting a Zuum/Plant.

By purehatred89 on Saturday, June 30, 2012 - 07:58 am:

It doesn't seem to be just emulators. I recently got
a copy of MR2 and played it on my PS3. All DVDs
spawned a Zuum/Baku for me, must be something in the
way they're coded.

By fiffa46 on Saturday, June 30, 2012 - 06:17 pm:

Well MR2 was built on a system that was not capable of reading DvD's.

By OgreBattle on Wednesday, July 4, 2012 - 12:50 pm:

Just used Total Recall dvd in MR2.

Gave me a Dribbler (Niton/???), the soccer one.

WTF.
